result.execSummary:
The defendant Robynne E Mattsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No objection to transfer of probation to County of residence.
Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and taken in the amount prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow through. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robynne E Mattsen

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 3:47 pm. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ and with Attorney Kat Yanke. 
Waiver of Prelim needed today as well. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANT. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to DRI Count 2. 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

Waiver of Prelim filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

PLEA to Count 1>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation, to run CONCURRENT to any sentence currently serving; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances, unless prescribed and taken in the amount prescribed.  AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 30 days credit. 
No objection to transfer of probation to County of residence. 

Adj: 3:59 pm.
Brought to jail from Taycheedah on writ, no warrant fee.
From Taycheedah Correctional, PLEAH on  10/31 @ 3:30
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
